column4: Hi all.... what I can use to run Quicktime movies under Firefox?
Thanks lethu, but I'm getting "No picture" when hit a site that has QuickTime
are you sure firefox actually uses the mplayer plugin? usually it uses totem's plugin by default
see if the quicktime video area looks like mplayer or totem
can't say for sure, it's just a black box where the Quicktime is suppose to play and in the middle of the black box it just says "(no picutre)"
okey tell me what you have in /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins
I have the following files: libjavaplugin.so  libvlcplugin.so  raclass.zip
looks like you are missing plugins, you sure you have mozilla-mplayer installed?

I think I fix it, what I did was "sudo apt-get remove mozilla-plugin-vlc" and relauched Firefox.... and now it works... but I have small black dashes on top of the video, I can see the video fine but it has small black dishes
joseaa, nice, dunno about the black dashes issue though srry
nice, dunno about the black dashes issue though srry
Thanks, lethu, with the ls on that directory I wouldn't even though vlc was the problem....
